intro: Caragana arborescens var. marjanovii, commonly known as the Mongolian peashrub, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Central Asia. It features compound leaves with 10–20 pairs of oval, glandular leaflets. The plant produces yellow flowers in racemes, followed by elongated pods containing small, edible seeds. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resistance to drought and poor soil conditions. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils.
